intro: Hypochaeris odorata, commonly known as the sweet violet, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers with yellow centers, which bloom from spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it is often found in meadows and along woodland edges. Hypochaeris odorata is also known for its pleasant fragrance, which attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
